title: The Age of Titans
content:
# The Age of Titans

Before mortals walked the world, the **Primordial Titans** shaped reality itself.

## The Five Titans

- **Terros** - Titan of Earth and Stone
- **Aqualis** - Titan of Seas and Rivers
- **Pyronax** - Titan of Fire and Forge
- **Zephyros** - Titan of Wind and Sky
- **Umbral** - Titan of Shadow and Night

## The Shaping

For millennia, the titans shaped the world, their conflicts creating mountains and carving oceans. The magical leylines that crisscross Aetheria are scars from their battles.

## The Slumber

Eventually, exhausted from their eternal conflicts, the titans entered a deep slumber. Their sleeping forms became the great landmarks of the world.

title: The Mortal Dawn
content:
# The Mortal Dawn

As the titans slept, new life emerged from the residual magic.

## First Races

### Elves
Born from starlight and dreams, the elves were the first to develop civilization.

### Dwarves
Forged from the dreams of Terros, dwarves emerged from the mountains.

### Humans
Arising from the intersection of all elemental forces, humans proved the most adaptable.

## The First Kingdoms

The mortal races built their first cities near leyline convergences, harnessing residual titan magic.

title: The Sundering
content:
# The Sundering

*800 years ago*

The greatest catastrophe in recorded history.

## The Cause

Two rival arcane empires, the **Valdris Imperium** and the **Thauman Concordat**, engaged in a magical arms race that culminated in disaster.

## The Event

Both empires attempted to awaken sleeping titans to use as weapons. The conflicting rituals tore reality apart, creating the **Shattered Wastes**.

## Aftermath

- Both empires destroyed completely
- The Shattered Wastes remain unstable to this day
- Magic became less predictable worldwide
- Several titan fragments were scattered across the world

> *"The sky burned purple for a year. Those who looked upon the Sundering directly lost their minds."* — Sage Aldric's Account

title: The Whisperwood
content:
# The Whisperwood

**Type:** Ancient Sentient Forest  
**Location:** Central Aetheria  
**Danger Level:** Moderate to High

## Overview

The Whisperwood is not merely a forest—it is a single, vast organism that has existed since before the Mortal Dawn.

## Notable Features

### The Speaking Trees
Trees in the Whisperwood communicate through a fungal network. Those with nature magic can tap into this network.

### The Verdant Court
Hidden elven cities exist within the canopy, protected by ancient pacts with the forest itself.

### The Heart Tree
At the forest's center stands a colossal tree said to contain the memories of every creature that has ever lived within the wood.

## Encounters

| Creature | CR | Notes |
|----------|-----|-------|
| Whisper Wolves | 2 | Silent, pack hunters |
| Dryads | 1 | Protectors of groves |
| Treant Elders | 9 | Ancient guardians |

title: Crystal Drake
content:
# Crystal Drake

**Type:** Dragon (Elemental)  
**Size:** Large  
**CR:** 8

## Description

Wingless dragons that have evolved to feed on raw magical energy. Their scales are crystalline and refract light into rainbow patterns.

## Habitat

Found exclusively in the Crystal Peaks and areas of high magical concentration.

## Abilities

- **Mana Drain:** Can absorb spell energy directed at them
- **Crystal Breath:** Cone of crystalline shards (6d6 piercing)
- **Arcane Sight:** Can see magical auras and leylines
- **Spell Reflection:** 50% chance to reflect spells of 3rd level or lower

## Behavior

Unlike true dragons, crystal drakes are not inherently aggressive. They become territorial only when their food source (magical energy) is threatened.

## Loot

- Crystal Drake Scales (500gp each, used in arcane crafting)
- Mana Core (2000gp, rare alchemical component)

title: Archmage Valerius
content:
# Archmage Valerius

**Role:** Quest Giver / Mentor  
**Location:** Celestial Observatory  
**Alignment:** Neutral Good

## Appearance

Elderly human male with long silver beard. Wears deep blue robes embroidered with constellations. Missing his left eye, replaced with a crystal that glows faintly.

## Personality

- Speaks in riddles and metaphors
- Genuinely cares about preventing another Sundering
- Has a dry, sardonic sense of humor
- Easily distracted by magical phenomena

## Background

One of the few living mortals who witnessed the Sundering (sustained by magic). Has dedicated his life to understanding what happened and preventing it from recurring.

## Connections

- Former mentor to the antagonist
- Has contacts in every major city
- Owes a debt to the Fey Courts

## Voice Notes

*"Ah, young ones. You remind me of myself, centuries ago. Full of certainty. Certainty is a luxury the wise cannot afford."*
